TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 934
TEI.2.document_title: Elijah Allcorn to Harrison and Hopkins, 11-06-1824

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 934

div1.p: Received Natchitoches 6 Nov. 1824 of Harrison and Hopkins in my waggon now at this place, and bound for San Felipe de Austin, to Say,— Two Dutch ovens and Lids Six Irons Pots one Dozen Tin Cups one Box crackers one Bag Coffee and Rice one Bag Salt and Keg Sugar one paper containing three pair Brogans, and paper cont'g two dozen Knives and forks one Box Cont'g sundries and one Do containing Nails and sad Irons all in good order and to be delivered in like good order to Samuel M Williams at the above mentioned place San Felipe de austin or his assigns he or they paying me the customary carriage on the said goods.—Signed duplicates, the day above written one of which being accomplished the other to Stand Void.—
Total Weight of the articles above Stated 758 Lbs.—
